024
025package io.blt.test.assertj;
026
027import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
028import java.lang.reflect.Method;
029import java.util.Arrays;
030import org.assertj.core.api.ObjectAssert;
031import org.assertj.core.internal.Failures;
032
033import static org.assertj.core.api.Assertions.assertThat;
034
035/**
036 * Assertion factory methods that allow testing the annotations of various types.
037 * <p>
038 * Each method is a static factory for an annotation specific assertion object
039 * i.e. each method returns {@code ObjectAssert<T extends Annotation>}.
040 * </p>
041 * e.g.
042 * <pre>{@code
043 * @Test
044 * void isAnnotatedAsTransactionalWithNoRollbackForException() {
045 *     assertHasAnnotation(NotificationPublisher.class, Transactional.class)
046 *             .extracting(Transactional::noRollbackFor)
047 *             .isEqualTo(Exception.class);
048 * }
049 * }</pre>
050 */
051public final class AnnotationAssertions {
052
053    private AnnotationAssertions() {
054        throw new IllegalAccessError("Utility class should be accessed statically and never constructed");
055    }
056
057    /**
058     * Asserts that a {@code Method} is annotated with a given annotation.
059     * <p>
060     * If present, an assertion object is returned for the found annotation instance, else the test fails.
061     * </p>
062     * e.g.
063     * <pre>{@code
064     * @Test
065     * void isAnnotatedAsTransactionalWithNoRollbackForException() throws Exception {
066     *     var method = NotificationPublisher.class.getMethod("sendNotification");
067     *
068     *     assertHasAnnotation(method, Transactional.class)
069     *             .extracting(Transactional::noRollbackFor)
070     *             .isEqualTo(Exception.class);
071     * }
072     * }</pre>
073     *
074     * @param method     a {@code Method} to test for the presence of {@code annotation}
075     * @param annotation the expected {@code Annotation} type
076     * @param <T>        type of {@code Annotation}
077     * @return an assertion object for the found annotation i.e. {@code ObjectAssert<T extends Annotation>}
078     */
079    public static <T extends Annotation> ObjectAssert<T> assertHasAnnotation(Method method, Class<T> annotation) {
080        return assertThat(findAnnotationOfTypeOrFail(method.getAnnotations(), annotation));
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Asserts that a {@code Class} is annotated with a given annotation.
085     * <p>
086     * If present, an assertion object is returned for the found annotation instance, else the test fails.
087     * </p>
088     * e.g.
089     * <pre>{@code
090     * @Test
091     * void isAnnotatedAsTransactionalWithNoRollbackForException() {
092     *     assertHasAnnotation(NotificationPublisher.class, Transactional.class)
093     *             .extracting(Transactional::noRollbackFor)
094     *             .isEqualTo(Exception.class);
095     * }
096     * }</pre>
097     *
098     * @param clazz      a {@code Class} to test for the presence of {@code annotation}
099     * @param annotation the expected {@code Annotation} type
100     * @param <T>        type of {@code Annotation}
101     * @return an assertion object for the found annotation i.e. {@code ObjectAssert<T extends Annotation>}
102     */
103    public static <T extends Annotation> ObjectAssert<T> assertHasAnnotation(Class<?> clazz, Class<T> annotation) {
104        return assertThat(findAnnotationOfTypeOrFail(clazz.getAnnotations(), annotation));
105    }
106
107    private static <T extends Annotation> T findAnnotationOfTypeOrFail(Annotation[] annotations, Class<T> type) {
108        var instance = Arrays.stream(annotations)
109                             .filter(a -> a.annotationType().equals(type))
110                             .findFirst()
111                             .orElseThrow(() -> Failures.instance().failure(
112                                     "Cannot find annotation of type " + type.getSimpleName()));
113
114        return type.cast(instance);
115    }
116
117}
